newsitem.title: USA: DuPont to close Martinsville nylon plant.
newsitem.headline: DuPont to close Martinsville nylon plant.

text.p: DuPont Co said Monday it would stop producing mylon at its Martinsville plant by mid-1998.
The company said the facility, built in 1941, was the world's second nylon plant. It currently produces nylon for the apparel industry.
The plant's age and its small production capacity put it at a disadvantage compared with most other DuPont nylon manufacturing facilities in North America.
The company said staffing levels were not expected to change before the middle of next year.
Eventually, the phasing-out of operations will result in the elimination of about 600 full-time jobs. The specific timeline has not been finalized, it added.

DuPont said it would continue to own the plant site. DuPont Precision Concepts, a supplier of precision machined parts, will maintain operations there, employing about 50 people. In addition, there will be a small site-support group.
